channel.title: [317][HELP] Problem Using Custom Items [317][HELP]
channel.description: So I'm trying to code in customs to a 317. I have installed the model files and added them and i have them items but when i equip them it goes in the wrong slot. EG i have a death cape. and it wields as a weapon. [url=http://postimg.org/image/u55ngm1hh/][img]http://s10.postimg.org/u55ngm1hh/9119.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://postimg.org/image/ireiro1l1/][img]http://s10.postimg.org/ireiro1l1/Item.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://postimg.org/image/r0uzjtkp1/][img]http://s10.postimg.org/r0uzjtkp1/Wrong_Place.jpg[/img][/url]

item.title: [317][HELP] Problem Using Custom Items [317][HELP]
item.dc:creator: @graphitexhd graphitexhd
item.description:
@graphitexhd wrote:

I dont have ItemAssistant.java. and i cant seem to find “targetSlot = 1;” in the item.java file. from what ive been reading on the net about this problem ive added the id to the correct spot it just doesnt wanna work.

Read full topic

item.title: [317][HELP] Problem Using Custom Items [317][HELP]
item.dc:creator: @Kozs Kozs
item.description:
@Kozs wrote:

[quote=“graphitexhd, post:1, topic:534925”]So I’m trying to code in customs to a 317. I have installed the model files and added them and i have them items but when i equip them it goes in the wrong slot. EG i have a death cape. and it wields as a weapon.


[/quote]

This should be in client help but I will still help you!

Go into ItemAssistant.java

Look for something such as " targetSlot = 1;"

Above targetSlot = 1; put

That should work, if you have a problem finding ItemAssistant.java look in your Item.java

If this does not work I can help via teamviewer

Read full topic
